intro: Torilis tenuifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf hedge mustard, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems and alternate, narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in early summer. The seeds are enclosed in a dry, three-lobed capsule, which is a characteristic feature of the Brassicaceae family.
